overview_of_class: This course is the conclusion of a four-course sequence, BIOL SCI 215-CN, 217-CN and 219-CN. The course course covers basic concepts in biochemistry, emphasizing the structure and function of biological macromolecules, fundamental cellular biochemical processes, and the chemical logic in metabolic transformations. This course was formerly BIOL SCI 218-CN. Students who have previously taken BIOL SCI 218 should not register for this course.
name: Biochemistry
title: SCS BIOL_SCI 308-CN-62 Biochemistry

descriptions.name: Overview of class
descriptions.value: This course is the conclusion of a four-course sequence, BIOL SCI 215-CN, 217-CN and 219-CN. The course course covers basic concepts in biochemistry, emphasizing the structure and function of biological macromolecules, fundamental cellular biochemical processes, and the chemical logic in metabolic transformations. This course was formerly BIOL SCI 218-CN. Students who have previously taken BIOL SCI 218 should not register for this course.

descriptions.name: Registration Requirements
descriptions.value: A lab course, BIOL SCI 222-CN Integrative Laboratory, may be taken concurrently with this course. Prerequisites: BIOL SCI 216 or 219 and CHEM 210-A.

subject: BIOL_SCI
